climbs.name: Ken's Corner
climbs.fa: TR: Yuon Tai Bak + Karel Hrbacek + Sharon + Ken Roberts, Lead: Frank Bochanski

content.description:
Interesting all the way, with some real dihedral moves. 

  Up the open book / dihedral bottom to top. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Trad: Standard rack.

 For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector.
content.location:
Obvious inside corner / open book / dihedral between the left face and right face of this sector. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Some interesting moves and some fun moves. Harder if do not know good crack techniques. 

  Start on right side of obvious center gully. Up onto right side of platform, then up the corner/crack. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Shallow left-facing corner with crack in it, with a couple of sideways shifts. This crack/corner is well right from the center-right gully. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Wide variety of interesting moves. 

  Big tree is On. Start on right side of tree, next step left behind tree. Next up the gully, touch one hand to the top and stop. 

  Variation: Not use tree, and finish with feet on top of cliff (5.7+). 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Trad: R-rated. Â No protection that will prevent a ground fall for the first half of this climb.

 For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector.
content.location:
Left end of Left face of this sector, where it meets the right end of sector Fern Cliff. Find big healthy tree with wide gully above. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Couple of thoughtful moves. Short, but worthwhile if also climbing the route to its left. 

  Up the gully, then just before its top, step up right. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Less-obvious non-wide non-steep gully which rises up left from a short ways up the obvious  far right wide gully (which forms the left boundary of sector God Jam). Its bottom is about 5 ft up right from the base of the arete which forms the right edge of the right face of this sector Dime Store, and this gully rises up roughly parallel to that arete. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Fun moves, sustained in the grade. If only this were longer. Even more worthwhile if also to the route on its right. 

  Up the arete to its top. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Likely need directional protection to reduce the side-swing if a climber falls.   . . (short sling around small tree could work). 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Arete which rises up left from near bottom of the obvious wide gully. This arete forms the right edge of the right face of sector Dime Store. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Sustained interesting face climbing. 

  Start 7 feet right of big tree. Up the face staying right of the wide gully above the tree. But can use the shallow left-facing corner/crack in the gully for hand-holds (extra points if only use it for Left hand). Finish up the ridge to right of gully. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Left side of Left face of this sector, to the right of big healthy tree with wide gully above. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Not worthwhile except as a way to get between the bottom and the top of sectors in the Rock Dojo area. 

  Easy (but loose or slippery) up most of the gully, then a short thoughtful sequence at its top. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Though it could be Top-Roped, most people just climb it solo without protection (as a means of getting to the top of the cliff to set up an anchor for top-roping). 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Wide gully with dirt and stones. The least steep of the gullies around, with a steeper section at its top. Forms the left (west) boundary of sector God Jam. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Lots of thoughtful moves.   . . Likely more difficult if much less tall than 5ft 7in with normal reach. 

  Up the face, trend right near top (perhaps finish with route adjacent on right?).   . . (2011 print guidebook suggests finishing roughly straight up).   . . (could slso traverse left and join finish of route adjacent to left). 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On right side of the left face of this sector, just left of below vague ridge. Perhaps eight feet left downhill from the obvious (Woolworths Corner) dihedral separating the left face from the right face of this sector. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Lots of thoughful moves, delicate balancy in upper half. 

  Up right to bottom of left-trending crack, and up that, then finish right. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On right side of the left face of this sector, below right side of vague ridge, and perhaps five feet left downhill from the obvious (Woolworths Corner) dihedral separating the left face from the right face of this sector. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Couple of awkward moves. Perhaps worthwhile as practice on outdoor gully climbing. 

  Start below left side of large rock at bottom of gully. Up onto the rock, then up the gully. 

  Variation (avoids awkward finish, keeps similar difficulty): About halfway up, step Left then join the finish of the route on the left and finiah up left side of the arete which forms the left boundary of this gully.

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Obvious gully with big rock at its base, slightly left of the center of the (South-facing) right part of this sector. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting sequence in lower part, then some additional thoughtful less-difficult moves to finish.   . . (Likely more difficult for climbers less tall than 5ft6inch with normal reach). 

  Up the face a few feet, then move up right to meet the arete which forms the left edge of the obvious center right gully. Finish up the arete or along its right side.   . . (The arete could also be reached more easily by starting up the center-right gully partway and stepping left). 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of this Dime Store sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On the face which is to the right of the obvious corner (which forms the boundary between the ESE-facing left part and the S-facing right part of this sector), and to the left of the obvious center-right gully. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Short easy and moderate routes. 

  Top-Roping: Trees above cliff not far back available to use as anchors. Shortest access to climb the route at the far right of the sector, up the obvious wide gully (which has a thoughtful low-5th-class move at its top).   Otherwise walk a ways left along the base of various rocks until find a sufficiently easy way up around to the top. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
